title: I was the kid who loved the melted bits of crayons on the hot summer pavement more than the whole ones...

attachments.displayName:
I was the kid who loved the melted bits of crayons on the hot summer pavement more than the whole ones found intact, neatly tucked away, in the box.

I was the kid calmly, peacefully, serenely setting anything I could on fire, just to see how it melted and what it did to the flame.

I was the kid watching how water and light moved for hours, the one trying to pick out impossible patterns in the shadows.

I was the kid reading astronomy and biology and chemistry magazines because the macro and microscopic fascinated me.

I was that kid - and I am still that adult.

If you had known me, really known me, as a kid, my work would come as no surprise now.

Not one bit.

object.content:
I was the kid who loved the melted bits of crayons on the hot summer pavement more than the whole ones found intact, neatly tucked away, in the box. 

I was the kid calmly, peacefully, serenely setting anything I could on fire, just to see how it melted and what it did to the flame.

I was the kid watching how water and light moved for hours, the one trying to pick out impossible patterns in the shadows. 

I was the kid reading astronomy and biology and chemistry magazines because the macro and microscopic fascinated me.

I was that kid - and I am still that adult. 

If you had known me, really known me, as a kid, my work would come as no surprise now.

Not one bit.
